document.discussion_title: Coroner: Man Had Cardiac Event Before Fatal Accident | wltx.com
document.topic_text: Coroner: Man Had Cardiac Event Before Fatal Accident wltx 8:10 PM. EST August 11, 2016 File CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST Columbia, SC (WLTX) - Richland County Coroner Gary Watts says a man had a cardiac event before a fatal collision along Bluff Road Wednesday. Clarence Paul O'Berry, 71, was driving in the 5200 block of Bluff Road around noon when his car went off the road and struck a tree. Watts said an autopsy revealed O'Berry was having the medical problem prior to the crash, and may have been unconscious when he lost control of his vehicle. However, the autopsy also revealed that he died from injuries sustained in the crash. The South Carolina Highway Patrol continues to investigate the accident.
